medium:
Matrix for a lamp Corinth Type XXVIII only discus and part of rim preserved.13-R N. trench I, extension above mosaic pavement. 8/19/1937
Soft, fine, gray clay, color due to fire? Remnants of red-brown varnish. Raised concave discus with row of impressed dots; rim preserved decorated with impressed angles and dots; reverse roughly finished, flat bottom. Found with late C. 
max. d. .075; h. .022
creditline: Gift of the Committee for the Excavation of Antioch to Princeton University

texts.textentryhtml: Excavated by the Princeton-led team at Antioch-on-the-Orontes, present-day Antakya, Turkey, 1931-1939; with the Museum since 1939
texts.remarks: Batch edit for Provenance publication project

caption:
Turkey, Lamp fragment. Matrix for a lamp Corinth Type XXVIII only discus and part of rim preserved.13-R N. trench I, extension above mosaic pavement. 8/19/1937
Soft, fine, gray clay, color due to fire? Remnants of red-brown varnish. Raised concave discus with row of impressed dots; rim preserved decorated with impressed angles and dots; reverse roughly finished, flat bottom. Found with late C. 
max. d. .075; h. .022. Gift of the Committee for the Excavation of Antioch to Princeton University (Antioch a1326-L706)

Matrix for a lamp Corinth Type XXVIII only discus and part of rim preserved.13-R N. trench I, extension above mosaic pavement. 8/19/1937 Soft, fine, gray clay, color due to fire? Remnants of red-brown varnish. Raised concave discus with row of impressed dots; rim preserved decorated with impressed angles and dots; reverse roughly finished, flat bottom. Found with late C. max. d. .075; h. .022. Gift of the Committee for the Excavation of Antioch to Princeton University (Antioch a1326-L706)
